definition: the final (of a syllable) (Chinese phonology)/rhyme/appeal/charm/(literary) pleasant sound
sound/noise/note (of musical scale)/tone/news/syllable/reading (phonetic value of a character)
implicit charm in rhyme or sound/hinted appeal/interest
charm or grace (in poetry or art)
to rhyme/sometimes written 壓韻|压韵
pleasant lingering effect/memorable stylishness/haunting tune/aftertaste (of a good wine etc)
music/rhyme and rhythm/initial, 音[yin1], and final and tone, 韻|韵[yun4], of a Chinese character/phoneme
rhyming word ending a line of verse/rhyme
the final of a Chinese syllable (the component of a syllable remaining after removal of the initial consonant, if any, and the tone, e.g. the final of "niáng" is "iang")

sentences.english: Clouds were done with a basic airbrush on an additional layer.
sentences.chinese: 在另一個圖層上用基本的噴槍繪製韻。

sentences.english: Mings theory on poetic "rhythm" has two points.
sentences.chinese: 明人“韻”論在兩個層面上展開。

sentences.english: He knew he wanted the names to be alliterative, much like Luke and Leia.
sentences.chinese: 因爲他想使這兩個名字壓頭韻，就像盧克和萊婭那樣。

sentences.english: The band consists of singer, piano, large betti, guitar, drums .
sentences.chinese: 韻樂隊由女歌手，鋼琴，大貝提，吉他，爵士鼓組成。

sentences.english: Quanzhen Taoism Zhengyun is the songbook of Quanzhen Taoism.
sentences.chinese: 《全真正韻》是道教全真派的歌曲集。

sentences.english: Melody refer to the voice of the original cadence, is a spiritual experience.
sentences.chinese: 韻原來是指聲音的抑揚頓挫，是一種心靈的感受。

sentences.english: The elegance of the ancient music condenses into the deep national complex;
sentences.chinese: 詩文古樂的馨雅緻韻，凝結成鏗鏘悠遠的民族情節。

sentences.english: It originated in Nan Dynasty and a complete system was formed in Qing Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 馬蹄韻發端於南朝，到清代才形成一個完整的系統。

definition: abbr. for Shijing 詩經|诗经[Shi1 jing1], the Book of Songs
poetic essay/taxation/to bestow on/to endow with
pavilion with a view/high/tall/high fronted, curtained carriage (old)
surname Wu/area comprising southern Jiangsu, northern Zhejiang and Shanghai/name of states in Southern China at different historical periods
pen/pencil/writing brush/to write or compose/the strokes of Chinese characters/classifier for sums of money, deals/CL:支[zhi1],枝[zhi1]
word/statement/speech/lyrics/CL:組|组[zu3],個|个[ge4]/a form of lyric poetry, flourishing in the Song dynasty 宋朝|宋朝[Song4 chao2]/CL:首[shou3]
to carry/to take along/to bring along/to hold (hands)/also pr. [xi1]
rich/abundant/exuberant/to add for free/to throw in as bonus/to spare/to forgive/despite/although
surname Yun/abbr. for Yunnan Province 雲南省|云南省[Yun2 nan2 Sheng3]
